verses.text: 耶穌看見群眾，就上了山；他坐下之後，門徒來到他跟前，

words.note: Refers to followers of a master, especially Jesus

verses.text: 他就開口教訓他們：

words.definition: opened his mouth, began to speak

words.note: Refers to authoritative spiritual teaching

verses.text: 「心靈貧乏的人有福了，因為天國是他們的。

words.note: Here refers to one's inner spiritual being
Used here in a spiritual sense: 'poor in spirit'
A key concept in the Beatitudes
A central theological concept in the Gospels

verses.text: 哀痛的人有福了，因為他們必得安慰。

words.note: Refers to spiritual mourning or sorrow over sin
Refers to spiritual comfort from God

verses.text: 溫柔的人有福了，因為他們必承受地土。

words.note: In a biblical context, 'meekness' implies strength under control
Refers to inheriting the promised land/earth
Refers to the earth as an inheritance from God

verses.text: 愛慕公義如飢如渴的人有福了，因為他們必得飽足。

words.note: An idiom describing strong desire or yearning.

verses.text: 憐憫人的人有福了，因為他們必蒙憐憫。

words.note: Often implies receiving something passively, good or bad.

verses.text: 內心清潔的人有福了，因為他們必看見 神。

words.note: Often rendered with a preceding space (　神) in Bibles as reverence.

verses.text: 使人和平的人有福了，因為他們必稱為 神的兒子。

words.note: Often rendered with a preceding space (　神) in Bibles as reverence.

verses.text: 為義遭受迫害的人有福了，因為天國是他們的。

words.note: Refers to God's reign and realm, central to Jesus's teachings.

verses.text: 人若因我的緣故辱罵你們，迫害你們，並且捏造各樣壞話毀謗你們，你們就有福了。

words.note: A common phrase meaning 'blessed' in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 你們應該歡喜快樂，因為你們在天上的賞賜是大的；在你們以前的先知，他們也曾這樣迫害。

words.note: Lit. 'on heaven', meaning 'in heaven'.

verses.text: 「你們是地上的鹽；如果鹽失了味，怎能使它再鹹呢？結果毫無用處，唯有丟在外面任人踐踏。
verses.heading: Salt and Light

verses.text: 你們是世上的光。建在山上的城是無法隱藏的；
人點了燈，不會放在量器底下，而是放在燈臺上，就照亮一家人。

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to a bushel basket.

verses.text: 照樣，你們的光也應當照在人前，讓他們看見你們的好行為，又頌讚你們在天上的父。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for praising God.
Refers to God the Father in this context.

verses.text: 「你們不要以為我來是要廢除律法和先知；我來不是要廢除，而是要完成。

words.note: Refers to the Law of Moses.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.

verses.heading: Fulfillment of the Law and Prophets

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，就算天地過去，律法的一點一畫也不會廢去，全部都要成就。

words.note: Refers to the Law of Moses.
Refers to the smallest part of a Hebrew letter.
Refers to a small stroke distinguishing Hebrew letters.

verses.text: 因此，無論誰廢除誡命中最小的一條，又這樣教導人，他在天國中必稱為最小的；但若有人遵行這些誡命，並且教導人遵行，他在天國中必稱為大。

words.note: A divine command, like the Ten Commandments.
條 (tiáo) is a measure word for long, thin objects or rules/items.
A key theological concept in the Bible, especially Matthew's Gospel.
A divine command, like the Ten Commandments.
A key theological concept in the Bible, especially Matthew's Gospel.

verses.text: 我告訴你們，你們的義若不勝過經學家和法利賽人的義，就必不能進天國。

words.note: Moral rectitude, justice, often implying God's standard.
Experts in Jewish Law and scripture.
An influential Jewish religious-political party.
Moral rectitude, justice, often implying God's standard.
A key theological concept in the Bible, especially Matthew's Gospel.

verses.text: 「你們聽過有這樣吩咐古人的話：『不可殺人，殺人的必被判罪。』
verses.heading: Anger and Murder

verses.text: 可是我告訴你們，凡是向弟兄發怒的，都要被判罪。誰若罵弟兄：『你這蠢貨！（蠢貨：原文音譯是「拉加」，是亞蘭文侮辱別人的用語。）』，就要被公議會判罪；誰若罵：『你這白痴！（白痴：原文是希臘文罵人的詞語，但是有少數學者認為這詞語是源於希伯來文，而把它音譯為「魔利」，意思是「叛徒」。）』，就罪該送入烈火的地獄。

words.note: 貨 (huò) used as a derogatory suffix for people.

verses.text: 所以你在祭壇上獻供物的時候，如果在那裡想起你的弟兄對你不滿，

words.note: Locative particle indicating 'on' or 'upon'.

verses.text: 就當在壇前放下供物，先去與弟兄和好，然後才來獻你的供物。
趁著你和你的對頭還在路上的時候，要趕快與他和解，免得他抓你去見法官，法官把你交給獄警，關在監裡。
我實在告訴你，除非你還清最後一分錢，否則決不能從那裡出來。
「你們聽過有這樣的吩咐：『不可姦淫。』

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for divine commands.

verses.heading: Adultery

verses.text: 可是我告訴你們，凡是看見婦女就動淫念的，心裡已經犯了姦淫。

words.note: A common phrase in biblical context for impure thoughts.

verses.text: 如果你的右眼使你犯罪，就把它挖出來丟掉；寧可失去身體的一部分，勝過全身被丟進地獄裡。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here.

verses.text: 如果你的右手使你犯罪，就把它砍下來丟掉；寧可失去身體的一部分，勝過全身進到地獄裡去。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here.
Indicates movement away from the speaker or completion.

verses.text: 「又有這樣的吩咐：『人若休妻，就應當給她休書。』
verses.heading: Divorce

verses.text: 可是我告訴你們，凡休妻的，如果不是因她不貞，就是促使她犯姦淫；無論誰娶了被休的婦人，也就是犯姦淫了。
「你們又聽過有這樣吩咐古人的話：『不可背約，向主許的願都要償還。』

words.note: Used in negative command '不可' (must not).
Refers to God or Jesus in Christian contexts.

verses.heading: Oaths

verses.text: 可是我告訴你們，總不可發誓，不可指著天發誓，因為天是 神的寶座；

words.note: Used in negative command '不可' (must not).
Used in negative command '不可' (must not).
In religious context, often refers to 'Heaven'.
In religious context, often refers to 'Heaven'.
Indicates reverence for the following divine name.

verses.text: 不可指著地發誓，因為地是 神的腳凳；不可指著耶路撒冷發誓，因為它是大君王的京城；

words.note: Used in negative command '不可' (must not).
In religious context, can refer to 'the Earth'.
In religious context, can refer to 'the Earth'.
Indicates reverence for the following divine name.
Used in negative command '不可' (must not).

verses.text: 也不可指著自己的頭發誓，因為你不能使一根頭髮變白或變黑。

words.note: Lit. 'cannot'
In this context, it implies swearing 'by' something.
Measure word for long, slender objects like hair or roots.

verses.text: 你們的話，是就說『是』，不是就說『不是』；如果再多說，就是出於那惡者。

words.note: Refers to the devil or an evil person.

verses.text: 「你們聽過有這樣的吩咐：『以眼還眼，以牙還牙。』

words.note: Classical Chinese preposition.
Classical Chinese preposition.

verses.heading: Retaliation

verses.text: 可是我告訴你們，不要與惡人對抗，有人打你的右臉，把另一邊也轉過來讓他打；

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.

verses.text: 有人要告你，想拿你的襯衫，就連外套也讓他拿去。
有人要強迫你走一里路，就陪他走兩里。

words.note: A traditional Chinese unit of distance, roughly 0.5 km.

verses.text: 有求你的，就給他；想借貸的，也不可拒絕。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb phrase, e.g., 'those who ask you'.
Can refer to borrowing or lending money, or a loan itself.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb phrase, e.g., 'those who wish to borrow/lend'.

verses.text: 「你們聽過有這樣的吩咐：『當愛你的鄰舍，恨你的仇敵。』

words.note: Combination of 'hear' and experiential aspect particle 'guo'.
Often used in religious contexts for divine or authoritative commands.
Common in biblical texts, often refers to fellow human beings.

verses.heading: Love for Enemies

verses.text: 可是我告訴你們，當愛你們的仇敵，為迫害你們的祈禱，

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for oppression or affliction.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb phrase, e.g., 'those who persecute you'.
A common biblical term for communicating with God.

verses.text: 好叫你們成為你們天父的兒子；因為他使太陽照惡人，也照好人；降雨給義人，也給不義的人。

words.note: Often used in the Bible to express purpose or result.
A respectful title for God in Christianity.
Refers to morally bad or wicked individuals.
Verb-object compound, often used in a divine context for sending rain.
Refers to a person who is just and upright, often in a spiritual sense.
Refers to what is unjust or morally wrong.

verses.text: 如果你們只愛那些愛你們的人，有甚麼賞賜呢？稅吏不也是這樣作嗎？

words.note: Common in religious contexts, less so in everyday speech for 'reward'.
Historical term for public officials responsible for collecting taxes, prominent in NT.

verses.text: 如果你們單問候你們的弟兄，有甚麼特別呢？教外人不也是這樣作嗎？

words.note: In a biblical context, often refers to fellow believers or countrymen.
Refers to those outside the Jewish or Christian faith.

verses.text: 所以你們要完全，正如你們的天父是完全的。」

words.note: A common title for God in Christianity.
Forms an adjectival phrase modifying an implied noun, 'the perfect one'.
